results.title: True justice?
results.brief_description: Documentary containing sensitive material about the death, in 2004, of a young 17 year-old Aboriginal boy from Gamilaroi country (Walgett) known as TJ Hickey. Through interviews and news footage, the film attempts to establish the truth of what really happened to TJ whose “acccidental” death not only triggered a riot between the Redfern community and the police, but also conspiracy theories, rumours and media misinformation.
results.description: Documentary containing sensitive material about the death, in 2004, of a young 17 year-old Aboriginal boy from Gamilaroi country (Walgett) known as TJ Hickey. results.title: True homance
results.brief_description: As a memorial to love, the filmmaker turns to the camera in an attempt to document the experiences he shared with his first boyfriend, only to find the filmmaking process as illusive as memory.
results.description: As a memorial to love, the filmmaker turns to the camera in an attempt to document the experiences he shared with his first boyfriend, only to find the filmmaking process as illusive as memory.

results.title: True History of the Kelly Gang costume sketches
results.brief_description: True History of the Kelly Gang costume designer Alice Babidge uses sketches to distil various reference images into one thought, which helps her refine an idea.
results.title_for_label: True History of the Kelly Gang costume sketches
results.description: Rather than draw what the finished costume should look like, Alice Babidge uses sketches to distil various reference images into one thought. For Babidge, drawing helps “refine an idea”. The torn faces on the photos are to help actors imagine how they’ll inhabit the character
description_for_label: Rather than draw what the finished costume should look like, Alice Babidge uses sketches to distil various reference images into one thought. For Babidge, drawing helps “refine an idea”. The torn faces on the photos are to help actors imagine how they’ll inhabit the character

results.title: True History of the Kelly Gang costume sketch
results.title_for_label: GRAPHIC: Costume sketch: True History of the Kelly Gang
results.description: Rather than draw what the finished costume should look like, True History of the Kelly Gang (2019) costume designer Alice Babidge uses sketches to distil various reference images into one thought. For Babidge, drawing helps “refine an idea”, while the torn faces on the photos help the actors imagine how they’ll inhabit the character.
description_for_label: Rather than draw what the finished costume should look like, True History of the Kelly Gang (2019) costume designer Alice Babidge uses sketches to distil various reference images into one thought. For Babidge, drawing helps “refine an idea”, while the torn faces on the photos help the actors imagine how they’ll inhabit the character.

results.title: True History of the Kelly Gang armour
results.brief_description: The armour in True History of the Kelly Gang was designed by Alice Babidge, who wanted the thick amour to reflect the characters and have a rough and ready quality reflective of the times.

constellations_primary.name: Crime doesn't pay
constellations_primary.description: Ned Kelly's famous armour has appeared in many films, but the criminal myth speaks to how audiences have always been captivated by true-crime stories, from the beginning of cinema to today.

results.title_for_label: True History of the Kelly Gang costume armour
results.description: “It wasn’t… an aesthetic choice; it was about not getting shot!” costume designer Alice Babidge said about the Kelly Gang’s legendary armour. Set during the late 1880s, the armour worn in True History of the Kelly Gang (2019) would’ve been made by unskilled outlaws and the costumes’ tarnished, heavy steel reflects that rough and ready aesthetic. They also reflect the collaborative design approach and characters – actor George McKay (Ned Kelly) wrote reams of poetry in character, which Babidge carved into the armour with a key. Along with the hammered steel, these personal touches give the armour authenticity – something Babidge aimed for by sticking to the story’s realism and avoiding any previous Ned Kelly films so she wasn’t influenced.
description_for_label: “It wasn’t… an aesthetic choice; it was about not getting shot!” costume designer Alice Babidge said about the Kelly Gang’s legendary armour. Set during the late 1880s, the armour worn in True History of the Kelly Gang (2019) would’ve been made by unskilled outlaws and the costumes’ tarnished, heavy steel reflects that rough and ready aesthetic. They also reflect the collaborative design approach and characters – actor George McKay (Ned Kelly) wrote reams of poetry in character, which Babidge carved into the armour with a key. Along with the hammered steel, these personal touches give the armour authenticity – something Babidge aimed for by sticking to the story’s realism and avoiding any previous Ned Kelly films so she wasn’t influenced.

results.title: True friend
results.creator_credit: Elizabeth Phan, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Moving to a new city and making new friends is never easy, and Elizabeth Phan found it particularly difficult. Gradually, though, Phan was able to learn the meaning of the words ‘true friend’.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Elizabeth Phan, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
